txt.en: You have found the outfit and should now show it to Polla!
Polla Stoutley can be found behind the stage inside the Blue Theatre.\n\nYou have tried to keep the audience entertained with varying degrees of success and should now return to Polla.
This does not appear to be the outfit Robbo described...
'That was wonderful! Let us talk more off-stage.'
Instance: Bustle in the Blue Theatre

'I am beyond words, [placeholder]! They loved us!

'GÃ³thrik was even in the audience... did you see?

'Allow me a few moments to gather myself and then we can talk further! Oh, thank you!'
Talk to Polla Stoutley
The Cloudyheads are on stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nThe Cloudyheads are performing, so you should enjoy the show!
Tell a <rgb=#FF0000>story</rgb> to the audience
DNT
Watch the Cloudyheads perform in the Blue Theatre
Polla Stoutley can be found on the stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nYou have watched the Cloudyheads' performance and should now congratulate Polla and the others.

'Hallo again, [placeholder]!

'We do not have much time now, but I saw a lovely outfit in the halls back here that Polla might love. Would you mind looking for it?

'It's a very ornate dress! You'll know it right away, I swear it.

'Bring it to her if you find it, and then we can get on stage!'
Perform a <rgb=#FF0000>handstand</rgb> for the audience
Stand at the front of the stage in the Blue Theatre
You have reached the front of the stage and should now entertain the audience!
Talk to Polla Stoutley
Stand at the front of the stage in the Blue Theatre

'What is this, [placeholder]?

'Robbo told you to do this? Bah, he should know better! Thank you, but we simply do not have time for outfit changes now!

'In fact, we have only moments before we are expected on stage!

'[placeholder], I know this would be asking a great deal, but would you go on stage and keep the crowd entertained while we finish preparing?

'You could tell a story, dance a bit if you're feeling daring, or figure out something else! Hurry on!'
Stand at the front of the stage in the Blue Theatre
The Cloudyheads have negotiated a performance in the legendary Blue Theatre of Minas Tirith, but now they must think on how best to utilise the theatre's grand scale.
The audience applauds softly...
Polla Stoutley can be found behind the stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nYou have found the outfit Robbo described and should now bring it to Polla.
Stand at the front of the stage in the Blue Theatre
Robbo Gristback can be found behind the stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nYou have arrived at the Blue Theatre and should now help the Cloudyheads prepare for their performance.

Various outfits can be found in the halls behind the stage inside the Blue Theatre.\n\nRobbo mentioned seeing an outfit in the halls behind the stage. You should search for the most ornate one you can find.

The stage can be reached by passing through the short halls behind the stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nPolla has asked you to stall for time as the Cloudyheads finish preparing for their performance. You should try the things she suggested to keep the audience entertained.
<rgb=#FF0000>Dance</rgb> for the audience
Deliver the outfit to Polla Stoutley
Talk to Robbo Gristback
Search for the ornate outfit that Robbo described
Stand at the front of the stage in the Blue Theatre

The stage can be reached by passing through the short halls behind the stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nPolla has asked you to stall for time as the Cloudyheads finish preparing for their performance. You should try the things she suggested to keep the audience entertained.
Stand at the front of the stage in the Blue Theatre

The stage can be reached by passing through the short halls behind the stage in the Blue Theatre.\n\nPolla has asked you to stall for time as the Cloudyheads finish preparing for their performance. You should try the things she suggested to keep the audience entertained.
The audience seems enthralled by your tale!
The audience seems to be tiring of your act...

'Do not worry, [placeholder].

'Even if they grew tired of your act, which I am certain they did not, you gave us more than enough time to prepare!

'Make your way out to a seat in the audience, and we'll start our show!

'Thank you again!'
